dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: What are you...?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I’m... I’m nothing.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Oh. (then) You know, it’s okay if you don’t wanna be my girlfriend. You don’t have to make stuff up... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  57.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Can’t we just keep things the way they are...?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (hurt) Yeah.. Of course... He stops talking, gives her a bit of the silent treatment She can tell she’s hurt him. Feels guilty...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Do you... have to... do anything special when you go steady...?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (pouting slightly) No...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: So everything’s the same?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (obviously) Yeah... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Okay. We can go steady.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: ..-Really?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Sure. He smiles. Closes his eyes. Abby stares at Owen’s back... gently caresses his shoulder, running her fingers down hi arm... and over his hand. She takes his hand in both of hers, and lifts it, puts is against her cheek, closes her eyes -- it’s a gesture eerily reminiscent of the one she

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the Balding Man just before he died... And as they b drift off into sleep...

dialogues.speaker: TIMECUT TO
dialogues.text: THE VIEW FROM OWEN’S WINDOW - PRE-DAWN HOLD for a LONG BEAT, until the SUN just peeks over the horizon, FLARING CAMERA... It’s beautiful, lyrical... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  58. A THIN SLIVER OF GOLDEN LIGHT reaches over the bottom lip the window, SLICES silently into the room... projecting patterns on the wall... REVEAL OWEN and ABBY, bathed in SOFT BLUE AMBIENCE, aslee bed, like Romeo and Juliet. The LIGHT reaches toward them CLOSE ON ABBY’S ARM, as the RAY of SUNLIGHT slowly spread out... finally... TOUCHING her SKIN -- the delicate surfa BLISTERS SUDDENLY, starts to SMOKE -- ! ABBY’S EYES SNAP OPEN -- she yanks her arm instinctively of the light, startled, in pain! She backs quickly away f the light, into the corner, pulling the blanket around he She looks around the room in horror, stunned that she let guard down so low as to find herself right here, right no Beside her, Owen remains blissfully in slumber. Her back to the wall, Abby reaches over very, very carefully... grabs the cord, gently lowers the blinds... HOLD on her as she sits there... catches her breath...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE WORDS: “I MUST BE GONE AND LIVE, OR STAY AND DIE...” WRITTEN on a small SCRAP OF PAPER lying on the pages of a OPEN BOOK on Owen’s DESK. Below the words, a HEART has be drawn. LIGHT SUDDENLY SPILLS across the paper as we HEAR sound of metal BLINDS BEING YANKED OPEN. A HAND enters FRAME, picks the paper up -- It’s OWEN, having just gotten up; he reads the note, slee He turns the scrap over -- it’s a fully ripped open packa of Now and Later candies. He lifts the open book the scra was lying on, looks at the cover -- it’s “Romeo and Julie Owen looks back at the scrap -- SEES below the heart is written, “OWEN + ABBY”. Owen smiles. EXT. OWEN’S WINDOW - MORNING The window opens, and out pops Owen’s head -- he looks ar at the great drop below, to the narrow window sills, cove with undisturbed, virgin snow... How did she get up here last night...? It’s impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen sits among a rowdy CROWD of MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS, silently reading his copy of “Romeo and Juliet” -- his br furrowed, the book is hard to understand... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  59. The crowd starts to get even more excited, looking out th window -- Owen stops reading, looks out the window to see FROZEN LAKE, as the bus approaches... It’s a school field trip... Along the distant horizon, a PASSENGER TRAIN spee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Students file off the bus, carrying ICE SKATES; some HOCKEY STICKS and HELMETS... Mr. Zoric and a FEW OTHER TEACHERS supervise, directing the student traffic --

dialogues.speaker: MR. ZORIC
dialogues.text: If you play hockey, you play this side! Free skate, this side! Everyone careful for holes in ice! Stay! Away! From holes! We be watching! So you play safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Owen starts to put on his skates with the others, Kenn Donald, and Mark step up behind him -- Kenny puts his han Owen’s shoulder, leans in, speaking to him quietly, smili

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: I hope you been learning how to swim... Coz today you’re goin’ in... And the three bullies head out to the ice. Owen watches t go, with a growing sense of trepidation... and anger...

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL, FROZEN AQUEDUCT PIPE
dialogues.text: along the shore. It looks like the pipe we saw the night Balding Man dumped the body of the weight-lifter into the water -- only now the entire SHORELINE IS FROZEN SOLID. Owen’s feet trudge by the pipe in skates... He is scourin the area for something... A GROUP OF GIRLS skate into the area, laughing, trying ou their best (and not particularly impressive) figure skati moves -- one of them is the girl Kenny accosted in the po Ignoring them, Owen keeps searching; he spots something, it out of the snow... It’s a LONG STICK -- it could be th same stick the Balding Man used to submerge the body unde the ice, though there’s no way to be sure... Owen BANGS the stick against his palm, testing its streng

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny, Donald, and Mark make their way across the ice... Finally coming upon Owen, who stands about twenty feet in front of a HOLE IN THE ICE, holding the long stick. He stares at them. Kenny smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Is she ready for a swim...? Owen says nothing, just sets his jaw; but it is clear he very afraid... He grips the stick harder, raises it slightly, bracing himself for trouble... Kenny notices:

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Whattaya think you’re gonna do with that...?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (trying to be brave) I’m gonna... hit you with it... If you try anything... Kenny looks at his friends, smiles mockingly:

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Really...? Wow...

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE EDGE OF THE LAKE
dialogues.text: As he tries to organize a hockey game, Mr. Zoric suddenly sees Owen surrounded by the boys near the hole in the ice He watches them with growing concern...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE MIDDLE OF THE LAKE
dialogues.text: Kenny’s smile fades as he stares Owen down...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: You know what I think...? Owen remains silent...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’re gonna do a fucking thing... I think you're just gonna stand there, like the little girl you are... And I’m gonna grab that stick... and ram it right up your ass... And then...? (beat, hardens) You’re goin’ swimming. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  61. Donald sees something, is growing uncomfortable with all this; says quietly to Kenny:

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Dude -- Zoric is over there checking us out -- let it go... We'll beat his little ass later... But Kenny isn’t going to be the one to blink... he just k staring... Owen is trembling...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Gimme the stick... Owen doesn’t dare move. Kenny, sensing weakness, suddenly lunges forward, and Owen, panicked, SHUTS HIS EYES, and SWINGS THE STICK with ALL HIS MIGHT! IT CONNECTS squarely with the side of Kenny’s head, and Kenny DROPS, stunned -

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Are you fucking crazy!? Owen opens his eyes, shocked to see Kenny, crumpled on th ice, gripping his ear in excruciating pain -- BLOOD GUSHE Kenny starts to SCREAM -- !

dialogues.speaker: MR. ZORIC
dialogues.text: turns, hearing Kenny’s agonized screams -- one of the oth Teachers immediately heads toward the middle of the lake investigate -- Zoric is about to go too -- when he HEARS SCREAMS from the other direction -- ! He turns to see the GROUP of GIRLS at the shoreline, by t aqueduct -- the girl Kenny accosted in the pool is SCREAM and CRYING, horrified -- Zoric starts in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE LAKE
dialogues.text: The Teacher rushes to Kenny’s aid, shocked by the amount blood -- Owen watches, absolutely terrified at what he ha done -- ! He stands there, frozen... drops the stick...

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, AT THE SHORELINE
dialogues.text: We watch in WIDE SHOT as Zoric arrives -- the girls are huddled together, comforting each other; one of them poin to something by the edge of the lake -- Zoric looks, and blood drains from his face... He recovers, starts to pull the girls away -- then, he turns back, staring, aghast...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  62. JACK, THE WEIGHT-LIFTER’S BODY HALF-SUBMERGED under water, and HALF-FROZEN into the ice. CHAIN SAW CARVES around him...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS. FIRE TRUCKS. A CROWD has gathered, watching along with the Students as a CRANE lifts an ENORMOUS, SOL BLOCK of ICE CONTAINING JACK’S BODY into the air... We ZOOM SLOWLY in on MR. ZORIC in the distance as he animatedly describes what happened to a MAN IN A SUIT, wh has his back to us, taking notes... A PAIR OF COPS need t squeeze by, and Zoric steps aside, still talking -- as he the POLICE OFFICER rotate, switching places, we SEE Zoric been talking to the SMALL TOWN POLICEMAN from the opening the film; we CONTINUING ZOOMING SLOWLY in, until his HAUN and CONCERNED face fills frame...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE - LATE AFTERNOON ON OWEN, profile, his head hung low. His mother sits out focus in the F.G.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Give me one reason I shouldn’t suspend you, Owen... (beat) Can you think of one? Owen keeps his head lowered, miserable.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look, I know about Kenny and his friends, believe me -- I’ve had to deal with them many times -- but where would you ever get the idea that this is the way to handle things? This in not. The way. To handle things. Don’t you know what could’ve happened...? (then) You seem like a smart kid. I just don’t want to see you going down the wrong path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) (very softly, distraught) He’s a good boy... he really is... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  63. INT. OWEN’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Owen takes off his jacket; his mom is already ON THE PHON OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) Hello...? Is George there...? Excuse me...? This is his wife -- who's this...? The DOOR BELL RINGS. Owen looks at his mom, who is angril immersed; he trudges for the door, as he continues to hea OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) Well, hello, Cindy... Could you please tell George that I called, and that I need to talk to him...? About our son...? It’s urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- if he even gives a shit... Owen opens the door -- it’s the SMALL TOWN POLICEMAN:

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (grave tone) Hi there... Your mom or dad home? Owen looks at him, suddenly worried -- does this have something to do with Kenny...?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Um... yeah... (then) OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) (still on the phone) Thank you, Cindy... Goodbye... (hangs up, then, annoyed) Her FIGURE enters the hallway -- she slows, seeing the Policeman. Her tone immediately changes, quiets: OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) -..-Oh... What’s this about...?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: I’m afraid there’s been an incident with one of your neighbors here in the complex... So we’re just going around, talking to people... see if anyone knows anything... OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) ..-What kind of incident...? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  64. The Policeman glances at Owen -- this may not be appropri for his young ears; Owen’s mother immediately picks up on OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) (firm) Owen -- why don’t you go to your room. ..? Owen hesitates, disappointed. The Policeman smiles apologetically, and Owen heads off -- he steals a final l at them from down the hall -- OWEN’S MOTHER (0.S.) Would you like to come in, Officer...? As the Policeman enters... CUT TO: INT. OWEN’S ROOM - NIGHT Dejected, Owen enters, shuts the door... sets down his backpack by his desk when he sees a FLASH from outside hi window. He HEARS VOICES. He looks out --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: There’s ACTIVITY inside JACK’S APARTMENT. Owen looks THRO HIS TELESCOPE: it’s SEVERAL POLICEMAN in LATEX GLOVES... TAKING FLASH PICTURES... SEARCHING FOR EVIDENCE... Owen watches for a moment, transfixed... when he HEARS BARKING across the courtyard: he swings his TELESCOPE ove FIND VIRGINIA, out on her balcony, also silently craning try to spy a look at what’s going on in Jack’s apartment her tiny lap dog is cradled in her arms -- She turns, suddenly, SEEING OWEN STARING AT HER THROUGH T TELESCOPE -- she glares, goes back inside, yanks the drap shut. Owen sighs. Then he turns, LOOKS AT HIS WALL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ABBY’S ROOM - NIGHT Looking ill, Abby lies on her mattress when she starts to hear quiet KNOCKING on the wall... Morse Code... It makes her smile sadly. She looks over at the wall where she has taped Owen’s cheat sheet, starts to decode his tapping... She raises her hand, about to knock back when she hears M KNOCKING -- FROM THE FRONT DOOR. Abby, turns, frightened. INT. ABBY’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY - NIGHT Abby creeps toward the front door, on eggshells, trying n to make a sound... MORE KNOCKING on the door... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  65. She reaches the door, steps up on her tip-toes to look --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE PEEPHOLE
dialogues.text: The SMALL TOWN POLICEMAN stands outside the door, waiting Abby backs away from the door... stares at it for a LONG BEAT, not knowing what to do... Finally, she hears FOOTSTEPS, as the Policeman starts to away... hears him KNOCKING FAINTLY on some other door... INT. OWEN’S ROOM - NIGHT Owen lies on his bed, next to the wall waiting for respon from Abby. He gives up, disappointed. Turns off the light INT. OWEN’S MIDDLE SCHOOL - WEIGHT ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON CLOSE ON Owen on the bench press -- he pushes hard, huffi and puffing with the barbell; there’s a new fire in his little body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen trains in the pool, holding the edge, kicking his le

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey Owen... Owen looks up to see Mark, the smallest of the bullies standing there in his bathing suit -- he has a bit of a s on his face, he’s hard to read:

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Look’s like you went for a swim after all, huh...? Owen glares at him, wondering if this is going to be trou but seeing Owen’s expression, Mark immediately backs off:

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: I’m just kidding... And he moves off, sheepish, to the other side of the pool jumps in. Owen watches, surprised: is he afraid of Owen n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen emerges from the building when he overhears VOICES - suddenly backs away, frightened, hides behind a column -- Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  66. OWEN’S POV: DONALD and KENNY, a HUGE BANDAGE on his ear, have just greeted MARK, who’s just come out of the building; as Owe watches, an OLDER, TALLER KID (KENNY’S BROTHER) suddenly up behind Kenny, and playfully -- though brutally -- wres with his head -- Donald and Mark laugh -- Owen’s intrigue KENNY’S BROTHER How’s the cripple...! Kenny, the much weaker of the two, wrestles his big broth off, pissed, protecting his ear:

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, dude -- look out...! KENNY’S BROTHER (laughing) Man, that kid wailed on your ass -- (yells in his bad ear) Can you still hear me, bro -- ?!

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Stop...! He SOCKS his older brother hard in the arm; but Kenny’s brother only seems to enjoy it, this is his idea of humor Finally, he eases up, smiles: KENNY’S BROTHER You going home?

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: No, we’re going over to Mark's... KENNY’S BROTHER Well can I borrow your keys...? I forgot mine... Pleeeeeease...? Kenny softens, giving in -- pulls out his keys, hands the over; his older brother musses Kenny’s hair: KENNY’S BROTHER Thanks... See you at home, little girl... Kenny pushes him off, instantly mad again. Kenny’s brothe heads off. Kenny turns, sees Donald and Mark grinning:

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Shut up... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  67.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: (trying to stop smiling) We didn’t say anything...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Shut up... As they head off, Kenny glowering, his two friends trying hide their pleasure, OWEN SMILES... so happy to see the tables turned on his nemesis... OVER THIS WE HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: OWEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (quietly excited) Abby... I did it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen and Abby on the jungle gym. Abby turns to him:

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You did what...?

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: They were gonna push me in a hole. In the ice. So I got a big stick and I hit Kenny really hard in the head. He had to go to the hospital -- I was almost suspended. But I did it. What you said. I stood up to them. Abby looks at him, surprised... taking that in...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: ...Owen.

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: ...Yeah? Abby slowly leans in, kisses him gently on the cheek. She pulls back, smiles at him, proud. Owen beams, embarrassed Beat. An idea strikes; he asks quietly:

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Hey... You wanna go somewhere...?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (quiet, intrigued) Where...? He hops down, reaches out a hand to her, mysteriously; sh looks at him, then takes it, easing off the jungle gym -- CLOSE ON HER BARE FOOT as it touches the snow... and CUT Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  68.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: FOOTSTEPS ECHO... A FLASHLIGHT sweeps through FRAME, illuminating HAND-INKED WORDS ON AN OLD, DUSTY DOOR: “KEE OUT”, and “ENTER UPON PENALTY OF DEATH”. Owen enters FRAM pushes a shoulder hard into the door, it opens REVEALING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim, dingy, concrete space, but a secret world all its furnished with mismatched items salvaged from the trash: SUNKEN ARMCHAIR, an OLD COUCH, a THREADBARE PIECE OF CARPET... BEER and LIQUOR BOTTLES litter the floor. There are PILES of DOG-EARED GIRLY MAGAZINES. At the center of all is a BATTLE-SCARRED PING PONG TABLE, a hole punched through one side. Abby takes it all in, walking around with a childlike gri

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: There was this kid who used to live in the building. Tommy. He used to hang out down here with some of the high school kids, and... they would drink and smoke. Anyway, sometimes when the older kids weren’t around, he’d play ping pong with me. He was pretty nice, but... then he moved away. (beat, looking around) I kinda like it down here...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: It’s cool...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I don’t think any of the adults even know about it... Abby finds on old cassette player, presses play: “The Gun Brixton” by THE CLASH begins, as Abby continues her tour.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: So... what did you want to do down here...? Beat. Owen smiles, watching her...

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: I have an idea... close your eyes... Abby stops, looks at him. She smiles. Closes them. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  69. Owen quietly takes his PEN KNIFE out of his pocket. He glances at Abby, then opens it, presses his thumb careful against the SHARP TIP... He swallows, bracing himself... Then presses hard, suddenly, against the blade, SLICING O HIS THUMB -- he GRIMACES silently in pain, as it starts t BLEED... A LOT... He smiles:

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: Okay... let’s... make a pact... Abby opens her eyes. Owen holds out his BLOODY HAND:

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: «..you and me... Seeing the BLOOD, Abby immediately FREEZES in HORROR and DREAD... Her PUPILS WIDEN, like an animal about to pounce Oblivious, Owen steps toward her, hand dripping -- he off the knife, trying to allay any fears --

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: It’s okay -- it only hurts for a second, it’s no big deal... Abby backs away, her stomach GROWLING -- she holds hersel rigid, FIGHTING VICIOUS, HUNGRY URGES... when suddenly, s SEES OWEN’S BLOOD PUDDLING on the floor; HER EYES FIX ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD for a long, suspended beat, as she STARES, MESMERIZE LOSING HERSELF TO INSTINCT... Owen still doesn’t get it, ALL AT ONCE, Abby DROPS to the ground, HOVERING FEVERISHL over the PUDDLE on all fours! She SNARLS RAVENOUSLY -- OWEN watches in shock, as ABBY STICKS AN EERILY LONG TONG OUT of her mouth, begins LICKING THE BLOOD off the concre

dialogues.speaker: OWEN
dialogues.text: (breath stolen) ..-Abby...? Abby suddenly LOOKS UP -- her FACE, smeared with dirt fro the floor, is TRANSFORMED! She has DEMONIC EYES, her EXPRESSION IS TORTURED, SAVAGE -- she doesn’t even look l a child anymore...! QUIVERING PRIMALLY, she HISSES, archi her back, on the VERGE OF ATTACK:

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Go _ away...! But Owen can’t move... he is terrified... his eyes start well with tears... Abby GLARES FURIOUSLY, POSSESSED: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  70.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: GO...t!! But he can’t! Then -- knowing if she were to stay even an instant longer, it would be over -- she turns suddenly, making a break -- and RUNS WILDLY for the door -- ! Owen is completely stunned -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING ABBY -- as she SPRINTS MADLY, PANTING, GRUNTING like a wild, panicked beast! HER BARE FEET SLAP concrete, picking up speed -- WE STAY WITH HER AS SHE GOES --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Abby bursts into the courtyard and heads STRAIGHT FOR A TREE... like a feral cat, she launches right up the trunk CLIMBING SWIFTLY, EERILY -- her nails SCRATCHING, CLAWING the bark as she goes...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE TREE
dialogues.text: We FIND her, settling in the branches, RABID, her SENSES HEIGHTENED, a HUNGER UNLEASHED, NEEDING TO BE SATED... Sh peers around the courtyard below -- her pupils so wide, h EYES ARE SOLID BLACK... Suddenly, she HEARS a small dog’s

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: VIRGINIA is entering the courtyard, walking her tiny dog. She’s moving fast, angry, like maybe she’s just had a fig fifty feet behind, LARRY follows, trying to catch up; he calls after her:

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Goddammit -- Virginia...! But she keeps going, towards her building -- and directly into the path of -- ABBY -- who ABRUPTLY LEAPS DOWN, KNOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Besi them, the little lap dog growls and barks primevally -- Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  71. Hearing the screams, Larry begins to RUN! He comes upon t scene in utter panic and shock, freaking out -- he LUNGES suddenly at ABBY, KICKING her FIERCELY -- and ABBY is KNO FREE, TUMBLING into the snow -- ! Abby lifts her head, stunned -- her MOUTH OOZES BLOOD, PI OF FLESH STILL IN HER TEETH... Larry sees the BLOOD pouring from Virginia’s shredded nec he starts for Abby in a blind rage --

dialogues.text: What the FUCK -- ?! But before he can reach her, Abby, terrified, snapping ba to reality, TAKES OFF! dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (crying, hysterical) Somebody call 9-1-1...!!! SOMEBODY

dialogues.text: (agonized disbelief) Jesus Christ -- she bit her...!!!

dialogues.text: HOLD, aS DREAD sets in Owen’s eyes... Then, TIMECUT TO:
